component.name: Maxima
component.summary: A free and open-source replacement for the EA Desktop Launcher

description.p: Maxima is in beta. Parts of it may not be fully stable, and we're actively fixing bugs and adding features. Please create an issue if you notice strange behavior.

ul.li: Download & Play any build of a game
Launch EA games owned on Epic/Steam through Maxima directly
Playing games installed with EA Desktop on Maxima + vice versa
Displaying your in-game status to your friends, and viewing your friends' status
Support for launching Maxima through Epic/Steam

Full EA Desktop inteopabillity. Games installed with EA Desktop already appear on Maxima, but to take it a step further we'd like the ability to, for example, start a download on EA Desktop and continue it on Maxima.
Progressive/Selective installs; Some games are able to start without being fully installed, and some games contain language-specific files.
Status setting; locked to "online" at the moment

Battlefield 3/4 are currently unsupported due to how battlelog does game launching. This is on our radar, but isn't a huge priority at the moment. Please file an issue if you find more games that don't work
Old games like Dead Space 2 and BFBC2 are unsupported due to being pre-"Download-In-Place" era games. They have a different manifest format which we need to make a parser for.

description.p: It's the farthest you can get from the Origin.
